headline.main: 2 Forms of Malnutrition Worry World Health Experts.; Supports Connective Tissue

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.abstract: US public health experts worried about consequences of food shortages in several regions of the world are particularly concerned over 2 serious forms of malnutrition, marasmus and kwashiorkor; kwashiorkor results from serious protein shortage; is most likely to occur after weaning if infant's solid food lacks enough good protein; marasmus tends to come earlier in life and stems from over-all lack of good food (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Public health experts worried about the consequences of food shortages in several regions of the world are particularly concerned over two serious forms of malnutrition.
docs.snippet: Public health experts worried about the consequences of food shortages in several regions of the world are particularly concerned over two serious forms of malnutrition.
